intro: Acalypha corchorifolia, commonly known as silkyleaf ironwood, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
